intro: Lagophylla congesta, commonly known as the clustered leafless lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually reduced or absent, giving it a unique appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
